result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb Michael Mormon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Caleb Michael Mormon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Caleb Michael Mormon was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with 15CM351.
Defendant to report to Probation today October 5, 2015.
Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: 15CM351

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Caleb Michael Mormon

records.addlTxt: c: Def, Atty, DA, NRPD & E: Probation. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Katie J. Christiansen   DF:  Caleb Michael Mormon appeared.  Court called at 11:25 p.m.  Set for PTC.  There is an agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the Court.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Ct 1 with the Domestic Abuse Enhancer Stricken. Court reviews the Police Report.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 1 with the Domestic Abuse Enhancer Stricken. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
 

S/W 1 year probation with conditions. 
- Probation for 15CM505 to run concurrent with 15CM351.
- It is hereby ordered the defendant have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Trina H..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  
- DE to provide a DNA sample
- Court costs of $243 and $200 for the DNA surcharge
- DE can apply for expungement upon the successful completion of probation
- DE to report to probation today 10/05/15
- 20 days to appeal

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Trina H.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Matthew L Hartung,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Caleb Michael Mormon appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Waives speedy trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 11:15 am.
